decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Dismember, as well as card draw and mana fixing with Chromatic Sphere, Chromatic Star, and Ancient Stirrings. It aims to control the game by removing threats and landing game-ending threats like Ulamog or Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's hand while deploying efficient threats. It utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to clear the way for powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet. The deck also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, as well as card advantage engines like Dark Confidant and Tireless Tracker. The goal is to pressure the opponent early and maintain a strong battlefield presence throughout the game.

The main idea behind this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly, cast multiple spells in a single turn, and ultimately win the game by storming off with cards like Gifts Ungiven and Grapeshot. Cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer reduce the cost of spells, allowing for more spells to be cast in a turn. By efficiently cycling through the deck with cantrips and card draw spells, the deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces for a game-winning storm turn.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Ally creatures that work together to build a strong board presence. By using cards like Cavern of Souls and Ally Encampment to make your creatures uncounterable and Collected Company to quickly put multiple Allies into play, you can quickly apply pressure and outpace your opponent. The mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells like Path to Exile allows you to control the battlefield while maintaining a fast-paced, aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba, Prized Amalgam, and Bloodghast, then use cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to dig deeper into your deck and bring them back onto the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Life from the Loam and Conflagrate allow you to repeatedly dredge cards from your graveyard and deal damage to your opponent. The goal is to create a strong board presence and overwhelm your opponent with a steady stream of creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing their creatures, and disrupting their graveyard. It also aims to control the board with removal spells while building card advantage through card draw and recursion with Snapcaster Mage. Thing in the Ice serves as a win condition by flipping into a powerful threat. The deck utilizes a variety of counter spells and removal to maintain control of the game while slowly building towards victory through incremental advantage and tempo plays.

The main focus of this Modern Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand, control the board with efficient removal spells, and force them to discard cards through cards like The Rack and Shrieking Affliction. Ensnaring Bridge locks down creature-heavy strategies while cards like Smallpox and Liliana of the Veil help in maintaining control over the game. The deck utilizes a combination of hand disruption, removal, and discard effects to grind out the opponent and win through attrition. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the deck aims to win through resource denial and card advantage.

The focus of this deck is on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, alongside efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption cards to control the game while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying constant pressure and maintaining card advantage through card draw and recursion spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a versatile and aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through strong, powerful cards while assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate huge amounts of mana. By using cards like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Wurmcoil Engine, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish dominance on the battlefield. With the ability to search for UrzaTron lands and other key cards using Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings, the deck can consistently set up its win condition and outvalue the opponent.

The deck revolves around the idea of ramping up mana quickly to get to the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift. By sacrificing lands with Scapeshift, the player can deal massive amounts of damage to their opponent with Valakut triggers. Primeval Titan helps in finding the combo pieces faster, while cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Explore help in accelerating the mana base. Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash provide removal and interaction, making it a powerful and efficient combo deck in the Modern format.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing their threats, and drawing cards to outvalue them. It aims to stabilize the board with board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while using planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage and control the game. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Cryptic Command to deal with threats. Additionally, Search for Azcanta helps filter through the deck and find important spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to protect its win conditions like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes lands like Field of Ruin and Celestial Colonnade for additional control and win conditions. Overall, the key concept revolves around maintaining a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategies to eventually win through incremental advantage.
